entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: South to southeast winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale east to southeast winds gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to Orange wind warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale east to southeast winds gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 90 to 130 mm of rain. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected from this afternoon, but rates of 25 to 35 mm/h possible north of Wairoa. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 90 to 130 mm of rain, but 150 to 200 mm north of Tolaga Bay. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but possibly 25 to 35 mm/h north of Tolaga Bay and south of Gisborne City. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 120 mm of rain. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected from afternoon, but 25 to 40 mm/h possible east of Whakatane from evening with thunderstorms possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to Orange Rain Warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale east to southeast winds gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Note, severe gales expected to easing from the north this evening. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to Orange wind warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 120 mm of rain. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe southeast winds gusting 120 km/h in exposed places, especially in the west of the Peninsula. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to Orange wind warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Southeast winds may approach severe gale in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.
